page.title: 10Transport in Alderney
page.content: On the island there are many different methods of transport.On land there are buses,taxis,bicycle hire,car hire,Island tours and even a train(the only one left in the Channel Islands).This does trips from a station near the harbour to a quarry at the eastern end of the island.At sea The Condor Hydrofoil comes in three times a week from Guernsey in summer.There is also a service from Torbay in the summer.Smaller boats also do trips round the island and to France. By far the most important sea route is that run to Guernsey every week. Alderney Shipping brings most of Alderney's vital supplies and if ever a shop runs out of a product the answer is always "it's on the next boat"
